result.reason: On HiDPI/multi-monitor setups, SetResolution() uses Screen.Bounds (logical pixels) multiplied by ResolutionScalingFactor, but the scaling factor is sourced from the main form's Graphics context rather than the per-monitor DPI, causing understated resolution when the connection panel is on a different monitor or at a different DPI than the main window.
result.approach: In SetResolution(), derive the DPI scaling factor from the specific Screen that hosts the connection panel (use Screen.FromControl + GetDeviceCaps or Graphics.FromHwnd(InterfaceControl.Handle).DpiX / 96f) instead of the global ResolutionScalingFactor; apply this per-monitor scale to screen.Bounds to get true physical pixel dimensions for DesktopWidth/DesktopHeight.
